Approach

How I think about engineering.

The principles that guide how I design systems, ship features, and work with teams.

Performance as a product feature

Users don't ask for fast apps; they assume them. I treat performance as core UX, profiling, measuring, and optimizing critical paths.

Systems, not one-off pages

I prefer building composable systems—design systems, micro frontends, shared tooling—so teams ship consistently without reinventing patterns.

Ownership beyond tickets

I’m comfortable owning outcomes: debugging production, clarifying ambiguous requirements, and pushing back when scope hurts quality.

Next

Building something serious?

I’m interested in roles and collaborations where frontend quality, performance, and reliability are actually non-negotiable.

Let’s talk about what you’re building and where frontend can give you unfair advantage.
